result.execSummary:
The defendant Hoover Raymond Welch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Public Transit Operator, etc., a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(6)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
__________________________________
Court waives all court costs, surcharges, and DNA surcharge due to defendant's inability to pay.

charges.descr: Battery to Public Transit Operator, etc.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hoover Raymond Welch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded.  State has satisfied victim rights notification.  There is no restitution requests.
Statements heard from State, defense counsel, and defendant.  Additional statements from: Ethel W.
Court sentenced the defendant to 6 months in HOC consecutive to any other sentences with zero days credit.
Court sets restitution at zero.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court waives all all court cost and surcharges, and court waives the DNA surcharge due to defendant's inability to pay.
Appeal rights given.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
            Ineligible Voting Rights form

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Hoover Raymond Welch not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Hoover Raymond Welch not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Hoover Raymond Welch not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Henry P. or any Milwaukee County Transit Bus or Driver

Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Hoover Raymond Welch in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
